DataElement.preferredName: Choroid and Ciliary Body Uveal Melanoma AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic T Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the primary choroidal and ciliary body melanoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Choroid And Ciliary Body Uveal Melanoma Pathologic T Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel-containing membrane of the eye that lies between the retina and the sclera._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Tissue located behind the iris and composed of muscle and epithelium. Its functions include the production of aqueous humor and changing the shape of the crystalline lens._A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ObjectClass.preferredName: Choroid And Ciliary Body Uveal Melanoma
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel-containing membrane of the eye that lies between the retina and the sclera.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Tissue located behind the iris and composed of muscle and epithelium. Its functions include the production of aqueous humor and changing the shape of the crystalline lens.:A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B.

Concepts.longName: Choroid
Concepts.definition: A blood vessel-containing membrane of the eye that lies between the retina and the sclera.

Concepts.longName: And
Concepts.definition: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Concepts.longName: Ciliary Body
Concepts.definition: Tissue located behind the iris and composed of muscle and epithelium. Its functions include the production of aqueous humor and changing the shape of the crystalline lens.

Concepts.longName: Uveal Melanoma
Concepts.definition: A melanoma derived from melanocytes of the uveal tract.  It is the most common primary intraocular tumor in the United States and Western Europe.  Similar to melanoma of the skin, it is rare in Africa and Asia.  Diagnostic procedures include ophthalmoscopic exam, fluorescein angiography and ultrasound.  Treatment includes: surgical excision of the eye, iridocyclectomy and tumor resection.  Recent treatments also include radiotherapy or photo coagulation.  Classification of uveal melanomas recognizes four cell types within these tumors: epithelioid, intermediate, mixed cell, and spindle cell types.  The spindle cell type uveal melanomas are further sub-classified as spindle cell type A and spindle cell type B.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9-6-19 TMT released per MC.; 12/10/18 tmt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Choroid and Ciliary Body Uveal Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 T Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel-containing membrane of the eye that lies between the retina and the sclera._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Tissue located behind the iris and composed of muscle and epithelium. Its functions include the production of aqueous humor and changing the shape of the crystalline lens._A finding about one or more characteristics of uveal melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to malignant melanoma of the iris, ciliary body, and choroid. Cutaneous melanoma metastatic to the iris, ciliary body, and choroid is staged according to the classification for melanoma of the skin and secondary intraocular extension of conjunctival melanoma is staged according to the classification for conjunctival melanoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion)._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Choroidal and Ciliary Body Melanoma pT4e TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Choroidal and ciliary body melanoma, any tumor size category with extraocular extension more than 5 mm in largest diameter. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Choroidal and ciliary body melanoma, any tumor size category with extraocular extension more than 5 mm in largest diameter. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Choroid
Concepts.definition: A blood vessel-containing membrane of the eye that lies between the retina and the sclera.

Concepts.longName: And
Concepts.definition: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Concepts.longName: Ciliary Body
Concepts.definition: Tissue located behind the iris and composed of muscle and epithelium. Its functions include the production of aqueous humor and changing the shape of the crystalline lens.

Concepts.longName: Uveal Melanoma TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of uveal melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This classification system applies to malignant melanoma of the iris, ciliary body, and choroid. Cutaneous melanoma metastatic to the iris, ciliary body, and choroid is staged according to the classification for melanoma of the skin and secondary intraocular extension of conjunctival melanoma is staged according to the classification for conjunctival melanoma. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: T Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. T refers to the extent of tumor involvement at the primary site (T, followed by a number indicating size and depth of invasion).

Concepts.longName: Category
Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
